title: Lightweight software can give that laptop a new lease
description: Don't throw away that old laptop. Use these software to revive it and give it a new life.
author: Pranav Bhardwaj
excerpt: Don't throw away that old laptop. Use these software to revive it and give it a new life.
text: If you have an old laptop that struggles to keep up with modern resource-hogging apps, you don’t necessarily need to retire it just yet. There are numerous lightweight applications that can give it a second life by reducing resource consumption while also delivering a decent enough performance. These programs are designed to be compatible with older generation hardware to let you make the most use of your laptop without sacrificing much on its functionality. Let’s explore the 10 such lightweight and free programs that can enhance the usability of your aging laptop. Related 5 unusual things you can do with an old laptop We all know that recycling old devices makes sense, but it's even better to repurpose them in a fun project 10 Midori - the lightweight browser Browse the web without taxing your laptop’s resources In modern times, a computer without a browser is not very useful, especially an old one. It’s almost impossible to run popular, heavyweight browsers like Chrome and Edge on your old hardware-based machine. That’s where Midori comes into play. It offers a highly stripped-down browsing experience that solely focuses on speed and efficiency. It’s perfect for lightweight tasks like reading blogs, surfing social media, checking emails, and more. Midori has a pretty minimalist design, and despite being simple, it has some useful features like tab grouping, adding bookmarks, private mode, and more. It’s certainly a great alternative if your laptop crawls when using any other browser. Your changes have been saved Midori Browser 9 LibreOffice - the lightweight office suite Handle documents, spreadsheets, and presentations without MS Office You don’t need the resource-hogging MS Office suite to access, create, and edit your documents on your PC when you have LibreOffice at your service. It’s a free, open-source tool that’s often considered the best alternative to Microsoft Office. It is specially optimized to run on older machines, so it doesn’t strain your system much while being active. LibreOffice includes essential tools, such as Writer, Calc, Impress, and more, to open file formats such as DOCS, XLSX, PPT, and more. Including it on your potentially throwaway laptop might make it a bit worthy. Your changes have been saved LibreOffice LibreOffice is one of the most complete Microsoft Office alternatives, and it's entirely free and open-source. It gives you various different tools for various use cases, including Math and Draw tools for advanced users.  Related Play videos and music without stuttering You might be living under a rock if you are a regular computer user and don’t know about VLC Media Player. It’s the most popular media player for a reason, and that is its compatibility with even the lowest-end laptop. This lightweight yet super-powerful media player can play almost any media format too, without needing any additional codecs. It delivers super-smooth playback even on your older laptop without overloading it. With additional features like recording, taking screenshots, up to 300% volume, online streaming, subtitles support, and even media conversions, I would recommend using VLC on every PC, irrespective of old or new. Your changes have been saved VLC VLC is free to download and use. 7 IrfanView - the lightweight image viewer View and edit images without slowing down Another useful tool for every PC is an image viewer and editor. Though Windows comes with a default app for that, it’s pretty slow and not very effective. That’s where IrfanView will help you. It’s a robust tool that instantly launches images even if your device is older. It also supports a wide range of image formats. Apart from image viewing, IrfanView also lets you make basic edits to your images, such as cropping, color adjustments, changing format, resizing, and more. Also, you get the option to add plugins to enhance its usability without installing a new program altogether. This little app is a perfect fit for your dated laptop. Your changes have been saved IrfanView 6 ClamWin - the lightweight antivirus program Protect your system without performance hits Generally, antivirus solutions hog up system resources to process scanning and removing malware from your PC. Since most antivirus programs are always active in the background for real-time scanning, your old laptop might not be able to process them, and that’s where ClamWin comes to the rescue. It’s an open-source security program that’s specifically designed for lightweight performance. It’s a handy tool to scan for detecting viruses, trojans, and other malicious entities. Unlike some other traditional antivirus programs, ClamWin doesn’t offer real-time protection, but it’s decent enough for your old device, which you will probably not use regularly. It also comes in a portable version, so you don’t even have to install it on your machine. Your changes have been saved ClamWin Antivirus 5 BleachBit - the lightweight disk space cleaner Free up valuable space with ease Source: BleachBit I like to clean my PC regularly to keep it running optimally. However, cleaner programs like CCleaner use excessive system resources to function, which is not feasible on an old hardware laptop. The best alternative to that is the BleachBit. It’s a pretty lightweight hard disk space cleaner that can detect and remove junk files, temporary files, app leftovers, and other unnecessary clutter from your laptop. Further, you can also clear your web caches and even eradicate the files on your PC so that no program can recover them. This app is even more useful for an old device that already struggles to run smoothly. Your changes have been saved BleachBit Compress and extract files quickly Most of you have heard of 7-Zip. It’s a highly efficient and popular file compression and extraction tool that supports a wide range of formats, including ZIP, RAR, and its native 7z format. It’s remarkably lighter than most alternatives, like WinRAR, ensuring efficient performance even on older laptops. The tool’s high compression ratio and ease of use make it ideal for managing files without slowing down your system. I have been using it on all my devices, old or new, and whether I am compressing large folders or extracting archives, 7-Zip always gets the job done effortlessly. Your changes have been saved 7-Zip Related How to Install 7-zip You can use countless programs to compress and unzip computer files, but 7-zip is widely regarded as the cream of the crop… once you get it working. 3 Notepad++ - the lightweight text editor Edit text and code without overwhelming your system. With Notepad++, you can write code and edit texts even on your low-end, old laptop. It’s a versatile text and code editor tool that’s as efficient as it is functional. Designed to replace the basic Notepad app, it offers syntax highlighting, tabbed editing, and advanced search options while remaining light on system resources. It’s popular among seasonal coders for its simplicity. It’s also available in a portable version, so you don’t have to install it on your laptop if you struggle with low disk space. Your changes have been saved Notepad++ 2 OpenRA - the lightweight game Relive classic strategy gaming without heavy system requirements Of course, you don’t want to miss entertainment on your old laptop, and what’s more entertaining than a strategy game? OpenRA is one such open-source reimagining of classic real-time strategy games like Command & Conquer, Dune 2000, and Red Alert. It’s less than 50 MB in size and is designed to run on modern operating systems while maintaining low system requirements, making it a perfect fit for older laptops. There’s also a portable version. The game offers multiplayer support, modding capabilities, and an active community. It’s nothing fancy and has no over-the-top graphics, but yes, you’ll be hooked on its gameplay. If you want to game on your old laptop without overloading it, OpenRA is a fantastic option. So, if your laptop is Windows-based and struggles even with the above-mentioned lightweight applications, switching to Lununtu might help. It’s a user-friendly and lightweight OS perfect for a laptop with minimal and old hardware components. Its minimum requirements are 1GB RAM, a Pentium 4 processor, at least 8GB hard disk space, 640x480 resolution, and a graphics card capable of running OpenGL 2.0. You can further enhance its usability via tools like Wine to make it compatible with Windows OS apps. Your changes have been saved Lubuntu Re-ignite your (almost) dead machine with these lightweight gems I always favor using laptops and smartphones to their maximum capacity (until their hardware totally gives up) instead of purchasing a new one after just 2–3 years of use. On the other hand, I also don’t want to spend unnecessarily on hardware upgrades. That’s where the lightweight software tools mentioned in this article come in handy. With the right software, you don’t necessarily have to perform a hardware upgrade on your old laptop. Instead, you can maximize its current potential and extend its lifetime with these little gems. Most of these tools also come in portable versions, making your work even easier if you struggle with low disk space.
